Docs.summary: Specifies whether the application install will create a shortcut on the desktop If True, the installation will create a shortcut to the application on the desktop. The default is False If Install is False, this value will be ignored
Docs.value: "true" or "false". A string that contains a value that indicates whether to create a desktop shortcut.

Docs.summary: Specifies the update location for the application. If this input is not specified then no update location will be defined for the application. However, if application updates are specified then the update location must be specified. The specified value should be a fully qualified URL or UNC path.
Docs.value: A string that indicates the update location for the application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property is not specified, no update location will be defined for the application. However, if application updates are specified, the update location must be specified. The specified value should be a fully qualified URL or Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisallowUrlActivation { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.DisallowUrlActivation : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Specifies whether the application should be blocked from being activated via a URL. If this option is True then application can only be activated from the user's Start menu. The default is False. This option is ignored if the Install property is False.
Docs.value: if the application is blocked from being started by means of a URL otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this option is `true`, the application can only be started from the user's **Start** menu. The default is `false`. This option is ignored if <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.DeployManifest.Install%2A> is `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Install { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Install : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Specifies whether the application is an installed application or an online only application. If this flag is True the application will be installed on the user's Start menu, and can be removed from the Add/Remove Programs dialog. If this flag is False then the application is intended for online use from a web page. The default is True.
Docs.value: if the application is an installed application; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this property is set to `true`, the application will be installed on the user's **Start** menu, and it can be removed by using **Add or Remove Programs** in Control Panel. The default is `true`. If this property is set to `false`, the application is intended for online use from a Web page and is available online only.
> [!NOTE] > For WPF Web Browser Applications, you must set the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.ApplicationManifest.HostInBrowser%2A> property to `true`, and you must also set <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.DeployManifest.Install%2A> to `false`. If this condition is not met, you will receive [MSBuild Error MSB3116](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/bb383983(v=vs.140)).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool MapFileExtensions { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.MapFileExtensions : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Specifies whether or not the ".deploy" file extension mapping is used. If this flag is true then every application file is published with a ".deploy" file extension. This option is useful for web server security to limit the number of file extensions that need to be unblocked to enable ClickOnce application deployment. The default is false.
Docs.value: if .deploy file extension mapping is used; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property is set to `true`, every program file is published with a .deploy file extension. This setting is useful for Web server security to limit the number of file extensions that have to be unblocked to enable ClickOnce application deployment. The default is `false`.

member this.MinimumRequiredVersion : string with get, set

[<set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")>]

Docs.summary: Specifies whether or not the user can skip the update. If the user has a version less than the minimum required, he or she will not have the option to skip the update. The default is to have no minimum required version. This input only applies when Install is True.
Docs.value: A string indicating the minimum required version number for an application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the user's computer has a version of the application that is lower than the minimum required version specified by this property, the user will not have the option to skip the update. The default is to have no minimum required version. This input applies only when <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.DeployManifest.Install%2A> is set to `true`.

Docs.summary: Specifies the name of the application. If this input is not specified then the name is inferred from the identity of the generated manifest. This name is used for the shortcut name on the Start menu and is part of the name that appears in the Add/Remove Programs dialog.
Docs.value: A string that indicates the name of the application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If no value is specified for this property, the name is inferred from the identity of the generated manifest. This name is used for the shortcut name on the **Start** menu and is part of the name that appears in **Add or Remove Programs** in Control Panel.

Docs.summary: Specifies the publisher of the application. If this input is not specified then the name is inferred from the registered user, or the identity of the generated manifest. This name is used for the folder name on the Start menu and is part of the name that appears in the Add/Remove Programs dialog.
Docs.value: A string that indicates the publisher of the application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If no value is specified for this property, the name is inferred from the registered user or from the identity of the generated manifest. This name is used for the folder name on the **Start** menu and is part of the name that appears in **Add or Remove Programs** in Control Panel.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool TrustUrlParameters { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.TrustUrlParameters : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Specifies whether or not URL query-string parameters should be made available to the application. The default is False indicating that parameters will not be available to the application.
Docs.value: if URL query-string parameters are available to the application; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property is set to `true`, URL query-string parameters are available to the application. The default is `false`, specifying that parameters will not be available to the application.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool UpdateEnabled { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.UpdateEnabled : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Indicates whether or not the application is updatable. The default is False. This input only applies when Install is True.
Docs.value: if the application is updatable; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property is set to `true`, the application is updatable. The default is `false`. This input applies only when <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.DeployManifest.Install%2A> is set to `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int UpdateInterval { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.UpdateInterval : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Specifies the update interval for the application. The default is zero. This input only applies when Install and UpdateEnabled are both True.
Docs.value: An integer that indicates the update interval for the application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default is zero. This input only applies only when <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.DeployManifest.Install%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.DeployManifest.UpdateEnabled%2A> are both set to `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Build::Tasks::Deployment::ManifestUtilities::UpdateMode UpdateMode { Microsoft::Build::Tasks::Deployment::ManifestUtilities::UpdateMode get(); void set(Microsoft::Build::Tasks::Deployment::ManifestUtilities::UpdateMode value); };

Docs.summary: Specifies whether updates should be checked in the foreground before starting the application, or in the background as the application is running. The default is "Background". This input only applies when Install and UpdateEnabled are both True.
Docs.value: An object that indicates whether updates should be checked before the application is started, or while the application is running.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this property is set to `Foreground`, updates are checked in the foreground. The default is `Background`. For more information, see <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.UpdateMode>.
This input only applies only when <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.DeployManifest.Install%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.DeployManifest.UpdateEnabled%2A> are both set to `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Build::Tasks::Deployment::ManifestUtilities::UpdateUnit UpdateUnit { Microsoft::Build::Tasks::Deployment::ManifestUtilities::UpdateUnit get(); void set(Microsoft::Build::Tasks::Deployment::ManifestUtilities::UpdateUnit value); };

Docs.summary: Specifies the units for UpdateInterval input. This input only applies when Install and UpdateEnabled are both True.
Docs.value: An object that indicates the units used for the property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following values are available for the units used for the update interval: `Days`, `Hours`, and `Weeks`. For more information, see <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.UpdateUnit>.
This input only applies only when <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.DeployManifest.Install%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Deployment.ManifestUtilities.DeployManifest.UpdateEnabled%2A> are both set to `true`.
